comment.author: 11226331@N05
comment._content: Probably Sidney James Alexander www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29886/supplements/29 - New Year Honours 1917, so no published citation Also has medal index card discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/image/Index/D9... which hints at slightly unusual service Also suggests he served with 14 Divisional Ammunition Column

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Yes, there is a story here, if someone has time to investigate it.  From the Supplement 5668 to the London Gazette of 10th May 1918.

"Temp. Capt. S. J. Alexander, M.C., is dismissed the service by order of General Court-Martial. 14th Mar. 1918."//

comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content: There is another Captain dismissed the Service by a General Court Martial on that same date, 14th March 1918.  London Gazette Supplement of 24th May 1918 shows him to be Temp. Capt. William Core M.B.  There is nothing to connect the two, but it is unlikely that there were two General Court-Martials convened on the same day, so there may be a link.  The difference in dates of publication could be because of 'promulgation of sentence' delays.  William Core, whose substantive Captaincy is published in the London Gazette of 10th July 1917 - effective from 18th April 1917, was an RAMC officer.
